quest.name: Best Laid Schemes
journal: Ilberd would like nothing more than to have this incident forgotten.

Ilberd wishes to join the 1st Unit in their pursuit of the Duskwight sellswords. However, the crate of weapons you and he have confiscated cannot simply be abandoned. He asks that you collect it and deliver it in his stead to Yuyuhase of the 3rd.
With remarkable ease, you secure the wooden crate filled with weapons. All that remains is to leave it in the care of Yuyuhase, who can be found on the Steps of Thal in Ul'dah.

You find Yuyuhase conversing with Alianne of the 4th Unit and her subordinate, Wilred, and place the crate of weapons at their feet. Although Alianne struggles to accept that the single crate is the entirety of the shipment, Yuyuhase dismisses the discrepancy as Riol's failure. After you part ways with the three Braves, Riol steps from the shadows and begs a private audience, though he does not explain why. Seek him out at the Sapphire Avenue Exchange.

After listening to your account of events at the Burning Wall, Riol shakes his head in disbelief and insists that something is not right. He reiterates his claim that there should have been more weapons, crediting his experience deciphering financial transactions, as he once did for the Crystal Braves to ensure that no funds came from unsanctioned sources─though such precautions are no longer taken, it would seem. Apologizing for his outburst, he takes his leave, moments before Tataru summons you to Revenant's Toll via linkpearl. Return to the Rising Stones and speak with the receptionist.

Tataru thanks you for returning so quickly and states that a guest from Ishgard has requested your presence. Given the urgency of the receptionist's summons, it seems likely that the envoy has a dangerous task in mind.
objectives: Deliver the confiscated crate to Yuyuhase in Ul'dah.
Speak with Tataru in the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: ILBERD
dialogue.text: I will join the 1st in their hunt for the Duskwight sellswords. If the gods are good, we will catch them before they escape into the Black Shroud.

dialogue.name: ILBERD
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I ask that you deliver these weapons to Ul'dah in my stead.

dialogue.name: ILBERD
dialogue.text: Entrust them to the 3rd's Yuyuhase. He will take care of the rest.

dialogue.name: ILBERD
dialogue.text: Pray take the black marketeer's weapons in that crate and deliver them to Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: ILBERD
dialogue.text: Seek out Yuyuhase of the 3rd unit on the Steps of Thal and deliver the crate into his care.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Why, Forename, this is a surprise!

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Rhesh wished for me to thank you for helping us to rescue her from Castrum Centri. How fortunate that we could meet again so soon!

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: Did you hear, my friend? I've received my first official assignment as a full-fledged member of the Crystal Braves!

dialogue.name: YUYUHASE
dialogue.text: Ah, the Warrior of Light, ever-reliable friend to the Crystal Braves. You have my deepest thanks for your assistance in Coerthas. Now, what brings you to us this day?

dialogue.name: YUYUHASE
dialogue.text: A gift of weapons from a certain black marketeer, courtesy of Captain Ilberd, you say?

dialogue.name: YUYUHASE
dialogue.text: Understood. Once we've cataloged the contents, I'll have them delivered to the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: This cannot be everything, can it?

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Riol stated with confidence that there would be a far greater quantity of weapons.

dialogue.name: YUYUHASE
dialogue.text: A blatant falsehood. Clearly, Riol is unfamiliar with the ways of Ul'dahn merchants, who ever strive to present themselves as greater than they are.

dialogue.name: YUYUHASE
dialogue.text: We should be thankful that his information was not completely erroneous, and that we managed to achieve anything of worth at all.

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: It's still something worth celebrating, isn't it, Lieutenant?

dialogue.name: WILRED
dialogue.text: Besides, we've got more important things to worry about─like fighting those Garleans up north!

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: There'll be no fighting if I have anything to say about it. Our orders are to stand watch, not to seek glory in battle.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: If you have no further need of us, then I shall take my unit to the Ceruleum Processing Plant.

dialogue.name: YUYUHASE
dialogue.text: Time for the 4th to earn their keep, eh? Fight well, Alianne─for the freedom of all!

dialogue.name: YUYUHASE
dialogue.text: Excellent work as always, my friend. Rest assured that the Immortal Flames will hear of your contribution. Until we meet again.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Forename. A word, if it please ye.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Not here─look for me at the Sapphire Avenue Exchange. No need for whistlin' this time, don't ye worry.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Thanks for indulgin' me request.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Few places better than a market for privacy, I find. All the hustle an' the bustle o' commerce means most conversations go unnoticed.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: I'll get to the point: at the Burnin' Wall, when you an' the captain interrupted the exchange, what happened? Tell me everythin'─leave no detail out.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Hmmm...that's not quite how the 1st told it.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: These Duskwights they were chasin'─latest word is that we lost the trail.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: But ye never saw 'em yerself? Not before the fightin' started, an' not after?

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Somethin' ain't right. I don't know what it is, but I can feel it in me bones.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: I'm not daft enough to be misled by some merchant's drunken boasts. Our information was reliable, godsdammit! I know he purchased those weapons!

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Hmph. As if I've never deciphered a moneylender's books, or had to follow a transaction back to its source...

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Did plenty o' that back when the Braves were gettin' started, believe me. The commander wanted assurances that we weren't takin' gil from the wrong sort o' benefactors.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: 'Course these days the money flows like water, an' the 1st an' 3rd get the shiniest new toys...

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: ...Forgive me, friend. I've a lot on me mind these days, an' I appreciate ye lendin' an ear. Right, then─best get back to it.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forename, can you hear me!? This is Tataru!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Your presence is urgently requested at the Rising Stones! Please come and see me as soon as you are able!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming so quickly, Forename!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: We've a guest from Ishgard who wishes to speak with you─a most, um...determined lady, by all indications...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename─we will be with you in a moment. Would you please wait outside with Tataru?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: You look well, Forename. We will have words when the Antecedent and I are finished.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis poor form to assault a guest in one's home. Alas, Moenbryda hath ever struggled to observe proper decorum.

dialogue.name: MOENBRYDA
dialogue.text: So this is an Ishgardian knight, eh? She looks the part, I'll give her that─but I reckon I could hold my own.
